verses.verse: Now it came to pass in the days<WH3117> when the judges<WH8199> ruled<WH8199>, that there was a famine<WH7458> in the land<WH776>. And a certain man<WH376> of Beth<WH1035>–lehem–judah went<WH3212> to live<WH1481> in the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>, he<WH802>, and his wife, and his two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>.

And the name<WH8034> of the man<WH376> was Elimelech<WH458>, and the name<WH8034> of his wife<WH802> Naomi<WH5281>, and the name<WH8034> of his two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> Mahlon<WH4248> and Chilion<WH3630>, Ephrathites<WH673> of Beth<WH1035>–lehem–judah. And they came<WH935> into the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>, and stayed there.
And Elimelech<WH458> Naomi<WH5281>'s husband<WH376> died<WH4191>; and she was left<WH7604>, and her two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>.

And they took<WH5375> wives<WH802> of the women<WH802> of Moab<WH4125>; the name<WH8034> of the one<WH259> was Orpah<WH6204>, and the name<WH8034> of the other<WH8145> Ruth<WH7327>: and they lived<WH3427> there about ten<WH6235> years<WH8141>.
And Mahlon<WH4248> and Chilion<WH3630> died<WH4191> also both<WH8147> of them<WH802>; and the woman was left<WH7604> of her two<WH8147> sons<WH3206> and her husband<WH376>.

Then she arose<WH6965> with her daughters in law<WH3618>, that she might return<WH7725> from the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>: for she had heard<WH8085> in the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124> how that the Lord<WH3068> had visited<WH6485> his people<WH5971> in giving<WH5414> them bread<WH3899>.

And she went forth<WH3318> out of the place<WH4725> where she was<WH8147>, and her two daughters in law<WH3618> with her<WH3212>; and they went on the way<WH1870> to return<WH7725> unto the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>.

And Naomi<WH5281> said<WH559> unto her two<WH8147> daughters in law<WH3618>, Go<WH3212>, return<WH7725> each<WH802> to your mother<WH517>'s house<WH1004>: the Lord<WH3068> deal<WH6213> kindly<WH2617> with you<WH6213>, as you have dealt with the dead<WH4191>, and with me.

The Lord<WH3068> grant<WH5414> you that you may find<WH4672> rest<WH4496>, each<WH802> of you in the house<WH1004> of her husband<WH376>. Then she kissed<WH5401> them<WH5375>; and they lifted up their voice<WH6963>, and wept<WH1058>.
And they said<WH559> unto her<WH7725>, Surely we will return with you unto your people<WH5971>.

And Naomi<WH5281> said<WH559>, Turn again<WH7725>, my daughters<WH1323>: why will you go<WH3212> with me<WH1121>? are there yet any more sons in my womb<WH4578>, that they may be your husbands<WH582>?

Turn again<WH7725>, my daughters<WH1323>, go<WH3212> your way<WH2204>; for I am too old to have a husband<WH376>. If I should say<WH559>, I have<WH3426> hope<WH8615>, if I should have a husband<WH376> tonight<WH3915>, and should also carry<WH3205> sons<WH1121>;

Would you wait<WH7663> for them<WH3860> until they were grown<WH1431>? would you refrain<WH5702>, for them<WH3860>, from having husbands<WH376>? No<WH1323>, my daughters; for it grieves<WH4843> me much<WH3966> for your sakes that the hand<WH3027> of the Lord<WH3068> is gone out against me<WH3318>.
And they lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963>, and wept again<WH1058>: and Orpah<WH6204> kissed<WH5401> her mother in law<WH2545>; but Ruth<WH7327> joined her<WH1692>.
And she said<WH559>, Behold<WH2994>, your sister in law is gone back<WH7725> unto her people<WH5971>, and unto her gods<WH430>: return<WH7725> after<WH310> your sister in law<WH2994>.

And Ruth<WH7327> said<WH559>, Entreat<WH6293> me not to leave<WH5800> you<WH7725>, or to return from following after<WH310> you<WH3212>: for where you go, I will go<WH3212>; and where you lodge<WH3885>, I will lodge<WH3885>: your people<WH5971> shall be my people<WH5971>, and your God<WH430> my God<WH430>:
Where you die<WH4191>, will I die<WH4191>, and there will I be buried<WH6912>: the Lord<WH3068> do<WH6213> so to me<WH3254>, and more also<WH4194>, if anything but death part you and me<WH6504>.
When she saw<WH7200> that she was steadfastly minded<WH553> to go<WH3212> with her<WH2308>, then she quit speaking to her about it<WH1696>.

So they two<WH8147> went<WH3212> until they came<WH935> to Beth<WH1035>–lehem. And it came to pass<WH935>, when they were come to Beth<WH1035>–lehem, that all the city<WH5892> was moved<WH1949> about them<WH559>, and they said, Is this Naomi<WH5281>?
And she said<WH559> unto them<WH7121>, Call me not Naomi<WH5281>, call<WH7121> me Mara<WH4755>: for the Almighty<WH7706> has dealt very<WH3966> bitterly with me<WH4843>.

I went out<WH1980> full<WH4392>, and the Lord<WH3068> has brought me home again<WH7725> empty<WH7387>: why then call<WH7121> you me Naomi<WH5281>, seeing the Lord<WH3068> has testified<WH6030> against me<WH7706>, and the Almighty has afflicted me<WH7489>?

So Naomi<WH5281> returned<WH7725>, and Ruth<WH7327> the Moabitess<WH4125>, her daughter in law<WH3618>, with her<WH7725>, which returned out of the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>: and they came<WH935> to Beth<WH1035>–lehem in the beginning<WH8462> of barley<WH8184> harvest<WH7105>.
